annonstext:
It is Janssen's mission to improve the diagnosis of immune-mediated diseases, to ensure and improve access to good treatments for patients, and to continue to offer new and better medication. We will continue to do so until immune-mediated diseases are a thing of the past. www.janssen.com/immunology We are now looking to fill a position as a Field Medical Advisor for our Immunology portfolio.

On behalf of our client, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are now looking for a Medical Adviser for a consultant assignment with the initial duration of 12 months. The workplace is located in Solna, Stockholm. We are looking for someone who is available to start by the beginning of April, or as otherwise agreed. You will be employed by FIRSTNAME LASTNAME and work with our client.

We are now looking to fill a position as a Field Medical Advisor for our Immunology portfolio. The purpose of the role is to improve company product value by being a therapeutic area scientific expert. To be responsible for discussing products, patients' treatment trends and studies in the Rheumatology area with a defined audience of Leading Specialists (Physicians, Pharmacists, Hospital Managers, Board Members of Scientific Societies, and other partners). In this role you should act and be considered a trusted scientific counterpart and partner. You will be supporting the current and future launches within Immunology, both in- and external.

We are looking for a person with a good level of seniority within the Immunology/Dermatology area, as well as with respect to working in Medical Affairs within the pharmaceutical industry. If you enjoy being a medical specialist and get motivated by interacting and collaborating with our external partners, then this is the job for you. This position will be based in Sweden and report directly to the TA Medical Lead for Immunology. The position will require travel mostly within Sweden up to 2-3 days/week.

Objectives of the Position

* Act as a reference point for other functions for any scientific query. 
* Coordinate and participate in medical education activities, e.g. identity, support, and educate speakers as well as build medical education programs with scientific third parties.
* Continuously update own knowledge of products, patient's treatment trends and clinical activities, as well as studies within the therapeutic area and patients' treatment trends in the region. 
* Develop and maintain a contact network with leading specialists with particular focus on understanding their needs, key value drivers, and practical treatment patterns as well as championing the medical value of own products. 
* Communicate medical scientific data to leading specialists and broader external health care related audience both proactively and reactively. 
* Gain valuable insights into treatment patterns and scientific activities in the therapeutic area through scientific interactions and provide strategic input to the medical affairs plan and business decision-making. 
* Support and handle medical affairs clinical activities' strategy, planning, design and execution in close co-operation with Global Clinical Operations and CRO. 
* Support the Health Economy & Market Access team with medical and scientific input. 
* Improve the use of multi-channel communication.

 

Qualifications

* A PhD is a strong merit. A completed bachelor's degree in medicine, pharmacy or life sciences or equivalent is required. 
* A minimum of 2 years of work experience in comparable roles (required), preferable within Dermatology. 
* Healthcare, pharmaceutical or similar proven experience (preferred). 
* Strong skills in Microsoft Office (required). 
* Valid driver's license (required). 
* Proficiency in Swedish and English language, verbal and written (required).

Application If you are interested in this position, please apply with an updated CV and Cover letter in English.
